result.execSummary:
The defendant China L Cleghorn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No Contact with any vicitm or the family or residence. 
Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant China L Cleghorn in court with Attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Schleis makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR   **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victim or family or residence


COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.** 

CONDITION TIME: 10 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agnet's discretion. 

*** Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.***

Defendant China L Cleghorn in court with Attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schleis requests a short adjournment as he is still waiting for discovery.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or their residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant China L Cleghorn in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
